title: GIFT Nifty up 90 points; here's the trading setup for today's session
summary: The Union Budget for FY27 maintained capex growth at 12% despite revenue challenges, with short-term borrowings rising. The Nifty saw a 2% correction on Budget Day, with analysts predicting limited further downside. A rupee recovery and an early India-US trade deal conclusion are key for a market rebound.

title: Stocks in news: BEL, HAL, ITC, Hero MotoCorp, Anant Raj, Adani Green
summary: Indian markets saw a sharp fall on Budget Day. Investors reacted to a tax hike on futures and options. While the Budget offers long-term growth, near-term volatility is expected. Several companies like BEL, HAL, and Hero MotoCorp are in focus due to budget announcements and financial results. Adani Green also issued a clarification.

title: Asian shares drop as gold plunge deepens, dollar gains
summary: Global markets experienced a downturn on Monday. Stocks and precious metals saw significant losses. The Japanese yen weakened considerably. This sentiment follows a volatile week and precedes crucial central bank decisions and economic reports. Investors are adjusting expectations amid these developments.

title: Sharp hike in STT pulls Nifty and Sensex down by 2%; brokerages feel the heat
summary: India's recent hike in Securities Transaction Tax (STT) on futures and options has triggered a significant market downturn, mirroring a similar event in 2004. The move, aimed at curbing speculation, has increased trading costs for all participants, impacting brokers and foreign investors particularly hard.

title: Buybacks to be taxed as capital gains; retail investors benefit
summary: The budget introduces a significant change in how share buybacks are taxed. Individual shareholders will now pay a lower 12.5% tax on buyback proceeds, moving from dividend taxation to capital gains. Promoters will face different rates, with foreign promoters taxed at 30% and Indian promoters at 22%.

title: Budget 2026 | Striking the right balance between aspiration and stability: S Naren
summary: Looking ahead The focus is on strengthening the foundations for next phase of economic growth rather than near-term outcomes; equities may see a good year if global markets stay stable

title: Foreigners get a direct pass to Indian equity
summary: India is opening a new avenue for foreign investors to buy listed stocks directly. This move aims to attract global wealth seeking exposure to the Indian market. The government has increased investment limits for individuals residing outside India. This initiative provides an alternative to existing investment channels and seeks to build resilience against foreign portfolio investor outflows.

title: Budget 2026 | Option to put a price on risk may mean we pay a price in future: Nithin Kamath
summary: The government's budget introduced changes impacting capital markets, including increased trading costs for futures and options, and revised tax treatment for Sovereign Gold Bonds. While buybacks are now more tax-friendly, efforts are underway to boost corporate bond liquidity and support export-competitive sectors like deep-tech and manufacturing.

title: Budget 2026 | Holding the line to sustain growth as India dreams big: Nilesh Shah
summary: India's latest budget balances fiscal discipline with growth support, aiming for an investment-grade economy through targeted measures and enhanced productivity. Prioritizing long-term stability, it features a credible consolidation path and a significant increase in planned capital expenditure, while a hike in securities transaction tax on equity derivatives poses a negative surprise for markets.

title: Budget 2026 | Strategic sectors get the attention; markets in range: Sanjeev Prasad
summary: The Indian budget offers a modest economic boost with increased capital expenditure, focusing on strategic sectors. While positive for earnings, market sentiment faces headwinds from higher STT on derivatives and a large divestment target. Investors should expect moderate returns amid valuation concerns and potential de-rating.

title: Budget 2026 | Capex push to have trickle-down effect; STT hike a negative: Raamdeo Agrawal
summary: India's Finance Minister Nirmala Sitharaman has announced a significant tax holiday for foreign companies establishing data centers in India until 2047. This move aims to attract global investment and boost economic growth. The budget also focuses on fiscal consolidation and increased government spending on infrastructure. However, proposed changes to stock transaction tax and buyback taxation have raised concerns among investors.

title: Why Sitharaman’s ninth budget chose continuity over courage
summary: Nirmala Sitharaman's ninth budget emphasized continuity, focusing on GDP growth and increased capital expenditure. While fiscal consolidation continues slowly, the budget introduced a securities transaction tax hike on derivatives and taxed buybacks, aiming to curb speculation and tax arbitrage. Asset monetisation is also being prioritized over outright PSU privatization.

title: Stock Radar: Jindal Steel stock breaks out from 18-month consolidation on weekly charts to hit fresh record highs in Jan 2026; time to buy?
summary: Jindal Steel Ltd shows strong upward momentum after breaking out of an 18-month consolidation. Experts recommend buying the stock for potential gains in the coming months. The stock has already seen significant gains recently. Traders can consider buying on dips towards the Rs 1,100 level. A target of Rs 1,600 is projected with a stop loss below Rs 1,020.

title: Union Budget 2026: For investors, a boring budget is a beautiful thing
summary: On budget day, investors and savers will notice that life goes on as usual. Despite some tweaks in tax regulations and the investment arena, there are no dramatic upheavals. The updates include slight modifications to the securities transaction tax affecting equity derivatives and capital gains on sovereign gold bonds. Meanwhile, the emphasis on nurturing a vibrant corporate bond market persists.

title: Gold, Silver Rates Today LIVE: Gold, silver prices rebound from multi-week lows
summary: Gold, Silver Rates Today LIVE: Sentiment for gold and silver prices remain weak amid a firm dollar, as investors gauged US President Donald Trump’s Federal Reserve chair pick Kevin Warsh’s approach to interest rate cuts.

title: Gold, silver rates today rebound after biggest single-day fall since 1980. Where's metal prices headed?
summary: Gold, silver rates today: Spot gold recovered up to 1% after dropping 4% in early morning session on Monday, during the Asian trading hours. Meanwhile, spot silver also rebounded over 8% to $84.140, after briefly falling nearly 12%.

summary: Gift Nifty was trading around 24,902 level, a premium of nearly 49 points from the Nifty futures’ previous close, indicating a higher start for the Indian stock market indices.

title: Sensex jumps over 200 pts, Nifty above 24,800 as investors assess annual budget
summary: Sensex and Nifty rebounded from losses in a special weekend session, as investors assessed the implications of the federal budget, which fell short of expectations for measures to attract foreign capital.

title: Hindustan Copper shares in focus as global copper prices slide
summary: Hindustan Copper shares will be in focus on Monday as sliding global copper prices dampen sentiment across metal stocks. A sharp drop in LME copper has raised concerns over near-term pressure on the company, with traders watching how the commodity weakness influences the stock’s movement after its recent rally and correction.

title: ITC shares in focus as cigarette prices rise after excise duty hike
summary: ITC shares are expected to remain in focus after cigarette prices rose sharply following the implementation of higher excise duties from February 1. The tax hike has raised demand and margin concerns, pressured the stock in recent sessions, and intensified worries around illicit trade despite stable underlying business fundamentals.

title: MCX shares crack 4%, down 20% in 3 days as gold, silver rout deepens for third consecutive day
summary: MCX shares tumble 20% in 3 days as gold and silver prices experience a significant decline, impacting volume and earnings. This volatility stems from speculation surrounding US monetary policy and the Federal Reserve chair nomination. Despite external pressures, MCX reported a substantial 151% year-on-year jump in net profit for Q3FY26, driven by robust operational performance and increased trading activity.

title: Hero MotoCorp shares in focus after 26% jump in January dispatches
summary: Hero MotoCorp shares are expected to stay in focus after the company reported strong year-on-year growth in January dispatches, supported by healthy scooter and motorcycle demand. Rising EV traction through VIDA and steady international performance reinforced its leadership position, even as near-term technical indicators reflected mild pressure.

title: Hindustan Zinc shares rise 4% despite silver’s Rs 1.44 lakh crash in 3 days. Is this a buying opportunity?
summary: Hindustan Zinc shares rose over 4% even as Silver prices posted a significant drop. This comes after Hindustan Zinc recently became India's most valued metal company. Analysts have provided positive ratings and target prices for the stock. The company reported strong Q3 earnings and has plans for future capital expenditure to support expansion.

title: Netweb Technologies among 4 stocks showing bullish RSI upswing
summary: On February 1, four stocks from the Nifty500 universe entered the RSI Trending Up scan after gaining over 3%. Their RSI readings moved above the 50 mark from lower levels, signalling improving price momentum and rising buying interest, a technical signal traders often track for potential bullish continuation.

Investors await these key results.

title: Silver rate today falls 4% on MCX, now down 39% from record high - Time to accumulate or exit positions?
summary: On February 2, MCX silver prices fell 4% to  ₹255,652, marking a 39% decline from its peak. Gold also experienced losses, while international markets saw a slight recovery. Increased margin requirements on futures are expected to heighten volatility in precious metals.

summary: Nifty 50, Sensex today: The trends on Gift Nifty also indicate a positive start for the Indian benchmark index. The Gift Nifty was trading around 24,875 level, a premium of nearly 22 points from the Nifty futures’ previous close.

title: Oracle Layoffs: Tech giant to slash 30,000 jobs as banks pull out from financing AI data centres
summary: Over the past few weeks, several US banks have pulled off from lending to Oracle for expanding its AI data centres, as per a report.

title: Budget 2026 not headline-grabbing but fiscally prudent and growth-oriented
summary: The Union Budget 2026-27 delivers fiscal prudence without sacrificing growth, keeping deficit consolidation on track while sustaining strong capex. Markets reacted cautiously to the STT hike, but measures on buybacks, PIS liberalisation, bond market development and support for sunrise sectors signal a steady, reform-oriented roadmap focused on long-term competitiveness.

title: Buy, Sell or Hold: Citi maintains sell on Jindal Steel; Bernstein maintains outperform on Bajaj Auto
summary: Brokerage calls show a mixed picture for investors. Citi remains cautious on Jindal Steel and Power, citing weaker profitability and pressure on realizations, while Bernstein turns bullish on Bajaj Auto, backed by premiumisation, improving margins, and export recovery. Citi sees continued auto volume momentum in January but expects limited Budget impact on overall consumption, maintaining Maruti Suzuki, M&M, and Hyundai as top picks.

title: Anant Raj, Netweb Tech, other data centre stocks rally up to 7%. What’s triggering the surge?
summary: Indian data centre stocks rallied as the Union Budget announced a tax holiday until 2047 for foreign cloud service providers, aiming to position India as a global hub. Companies like Anant Raj, Techno Electric, and Netweb Technologies are expected to benefit from increased data centre development and infrastructure demand.

title: Groww shares slide nearly 5% after Budget raises STT on F&O trades
summary: Billionbrains Garage Ventures, Groww's parent, saw its shares tumble following the Union Budget's hike in Securities Transaction Tax on futures and options. The increased STT rates, impacting derivatives trading, led to a broad sell-off in brokerage and exchange stocks. While potentially equity-positive long-term, the move could cause short-term portfolio rebalancing.

title: Top Nifty50 stocks analysts suggest buying in this volatile week
summary: Stock Reports Plus, powered by Refinitiv, is a comprehensive research report that evaluates five key components of 4,000+ listed stocks – earnings, fundamentals, relative valuation, risk, and price momentum – to generate standardised scores. The simple average of the above-mentioned five component ratings is normally distributed to reach an average score.

title: F&O profits at risk: How much one lot of Nifty futures and options costs after the STT hike
summary: The Union Budget 2026 has increased Securities Transaction Tax (STT) on equity derivatives, impacting futures and options trading costs. STT on Nifty futures has risen from 0.02% to 0.05%, increasing the cost per lot by approximately Rs 500. Options trading also sees a 50% STT hike on premiums, raising concerns about market liquidity and foreign participation.

title: Big tax change for investors! Budget 2026 sets new rule for interest against MF, dividend income
summary: The Union Budget 2026 proposes eliminating the tax deduction for interest on borrowed funds used for investing in dividend-paying stocks or mutual funds. This change affects all taxpayers and could impact investment strategies involving leverage.

title: Oil prices slide 4% on US-Iran de-escalation. Where are they headed in the near term?
summary: Brent crude futures fell $2.81, or 4.1%, to $66.51 a barrel, while US West Texas Intermediate dropped $2.70, or 4.1%, to $62.51 a barrel.

title: Small-cap stock MIC Electronics hits upper circuit after Q3 results 2026
summary: MIC Electronics shares hit a 5% upper circuit at  ₹42.82 after reporting a 667.91% YoY surge in net sales to  ₹90.23 crore for Q3FY26, despite a 13.36% decline in net profit. The company faces margin pressure amid recent growth.

title: Indian rupee jumps over 40 paise against US dollar: Can it rise further?
summary: The rupee appeared on course to open near its all-time low of 91.9875 against the greenback, but the central bank's intervention helped shore it up to 91.77, a gain of 0.2% from its closing level on Friday.

title: Hannah Joseph IPO listing: Shares debut at 7.6% discount to IPO price on BSE SME
summary: Hannah Joseph IPO listing: Hannah Joseph share price opened at  ₹65 on BSE SME. This means that the IPO allottees made a loss of over 7.6% over the Hannah Joseph IPO listing.

title: Budget impact: Indian government bond yields hit highest in one year. How can it affect stock market
summary: On February 2, Indian bond yields rose by 8 basis points after the government announced higher-than-expected gross borrowing. The 10-year bond yield reached 6.78%, the highest since January 2025, amid rising borrowing costs and limited central bank intervention.

title: Stocks to buy after Budget 2026: Anand James identifies 3 technical picks
summary: Union Budget 2026 backs textile modernization through various schemes, boosting stocks like Arvind and Raymond. The market shows signs of recovery post-Budget turmoil, with analysts noting resilient stocks amidst volatility and a gradual shift towards growth-oriented sentiment.
